text: There are several sources of stress in my life, but I would say the main source is my job. I work long hours and have a lot of responsibility, which can be very mentally and emotionally draining. I also worry about my family and friends, and whether or not they are okay. I think this is a common stressor for black women, as we often have to be the ones who take care of everyone else.
The main source of my stress is my job. I work in a high-pressure environment and I often feel like I'm not doing well enough. I'm constantly worried about making mistakes and letting my team down.

I would say that the main source of my stress is my family. I come from a very traditional Hispanic family, and there is a lot of pressure to conform to certain expectations. For example, I am expected to get married and have children, even though I am not sure that is what I want for my life. I feel like I am constantly being judged by my family and it is very stressful.

The main source of my stress is my job. I feel like I'm constantly under pressure to perform well and meet high standards. I'm also worried about being able to support myself and my family financially.

I would say that the main source of my stress is racism. I feel like I'm constantly having to prove myself and that I'm not good enough. I feel like I'm always walking on eggshells, trying not to do anything that might be perceived as threatening or aggressive. It's exhausting and it takes a toll on my mental and emotional health.
I would say that the main source of my stress is work. I feel like I'm constantly under a lot of pressure to perform well and meet deadlines. It can be really overwhelming at times.

The main source of my stress is my job. I work in a factory and I have to do a lot of physical labor. It is very tiring and I donâ€™t get paid very much. I also have to deal with a lot of discrimination at work. People usually assume that I am not intelligent because I am hispanic. This makes me very angry and frustrated.

The main source of my stress is my job. I work in a high-pressure environment and often feel like I'm not good enough. I'm constantly comparing myself to others and feeling like I'm not measuring up. This has a lot to do with my cultural background and the pressure I feel to succeed.
